tool.name: GDAL Informations
tool.command: gdalinfo '$input1' #if $settings.advanced=='advanced' $settings.mm $settings.stats $settings.approx_stats $settings.hist $settings.nogcp $settings.nomd $settings.norat $settings.noct $settings.checksum $settings.listmdd $settings.proj4 -mdd '$settings.mdd' #end if #if $format.value=='json' -json > '$outputJson'; #if $subdataset=='subd_y' cat '$outputJson' | grep -A 1 "\"SUBDATASET_._NAME\":\".*\"," | cut -d "\"" -f4- | sed 's/..$//' | sed 's/\t//' | sed -e 'N; s/\n/\t/' > '${input1.name}_Subdatasets' #end if #else > '$outputDefault'; #if $subdataset=='subd_y' cat '$outputDefault' | grep -A 1 "SUBDATASET_._NAME=.*:.*$" | cut -d "=" -f 2 | sed 's/\t//' | sed -e 'N; s/\n/\t/' > '${input1.name}_Subdatasets' #end if #end if

param.name: mm
param.label: -mm
param.help: Force computation of the actual min/max values for each band in the dataset.

param.name: stats
param.label: -stats
param.help: Read and display image statistics. Force computation if no statistics are stored in an image.

param.name: approx_stats
param.label: -approx_stats
param.help: Read and display image statistics. Force computation if no statistics are stored in an image. However, they may be computed based on overviews or a subset of all tiles. Useful if you are in a hurry and don't want precise stats.

param.name: hist
param.label: -hist
param.help: Report histogram information for all bands.

param.name: nogcp
param.label: -nogcp
param.help: Suppress ground control points list printing. It may be useful for datasets with huge amount of GCPs, such as L1B AVHRR or HDF4 MODIS which contain thousands of them.

param.name: nomd
param.label: -nomd
param.help: Suppress metadata printing. Some datasets may contain a lot of metadata strings.

param.name: norat
param.label: -norat
param.help: Suppress printing of raster attribute table.

param.name: checksum
param.label: -checksum
param.help: Force computation of the checksum for each band in the dataset.

param.name: listmdd
param.label: -listmdd
param.help: List all metadata domains available for the dataset.

param.name: proj4
param.label: -proj4
param.help: Report a PROJ.4 string corresponding to the file's coordinate system.

param.name: mdd
param.label: -mdd DOMAIN
param.help: Report metadata for the specified domain. Starting with GDAL 1.11, 'all' can be used to report metadata in all domains.

tool.help:
========================== Gdalinfo ========================== **What it does**
The gdalinfo program lists various information about a GDAL supported raster dataset.
It will report all of the following (if known):
- The format driver used to access the file. - Raster size (in pixels and lines). - The coordinate system for the file (in OGC WKT). - The geotransform associated with the file (rotational coefficients are currently not reported). - Corner coordinates in georeferenced, and if possible lat/long based on the full geotransform (but not GCPs). - Ground control points. - File wide (including subdatasets) metadata. - Band data types. - Band color interpretations. - Band block size. - Band descriptions. - Band min/max values (internally known and possibly computed). - Band checksum (if computation asked). - Band NODATA value. - Band overview resolutions available. - Band unit type (i.e.. "meters" or "feet" for elevation bands). - Band pseudo-color tables.
|
**How to use it**
Select from history a suported raster file and choose either Json or Text format for result display.
An additional option can list available subdatasets.
|
**Other options, advanced usage**
*-mm*
Force computation of the actual min/max values for each band in the dataset.
|
*-stats*
Read and display image statistics. Force computation if no statistics are stored in an image.
|
*-approx_stats*
Read and display image statistics. Force computation if no statistics are stored in an image. However, they may be computed based on overviews or a subset of all tiles. Useful if you are in a hurry and don't want precise stats.
|
*-hist*
Report histogram information for all bands.
|
*-nogcp*
Suppress ground control points list printing. It may be useful for datasets with huge amount of GCPs, such as L1B AVHRR or HDF4 MODIS which contain thousands of them.
|
*-nomd*
Suppress metadata printing. Some datasets may contain a lot of metadata strings.
|
*-norat*
Suppress printing of raster attribute table.
|
*-noct*
Suppress printing of color table.
|
*-checksum*
Force computation of the checksum for each band in the dataset.
|
*-listmdd*
List all metadata domains available for the dataset.
|
*-mdd domain*
Report metadata for the specified domain. Starting with GDAL 1.11, "all" can be used to report metadata in all domains
|
*-proj4*
Report a PROJ.4 string corresponding to the file's coordinate system.
|
**Sources**
http://www.gdal.org
http://www.gdal.org/gdalinfo.html
Raster Processing Tutorial : https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/UserDocs/RasterProcTutorial
